title: Old Judges for Sale or Trade--All available Cards Now Listed
author: oldjudge

posts.post_title: Old Judges for Sale or Trade--All available Cards Now Listed
posts.post_content:
I was the winner of Lots 47 and 49 in the latest REA auction. Of the total of 223 Old Judge cards in these two lots combined, about 170 are available for sale. Although all four Louisville cards are gone, two scarce Maroon cards, Van Dyke, and the Mascot card still remain. If interested in any particular card, please email me at [url]oldjudge@gmail.com[/url]. Images are available via the links provided below.

LINKS TO LOT 47 and 49


[url]http://bid.robertedwardauctions.com/bidplace.aspx?itemid=24583[/url]
[url]http://bid.robertedwardauctions.com/bidplace.aspx?itemid=24585[/url]

UPDATE--The following is a list of cards still available in each of the two lots. Please email me for prices. The above links have images of virtually every card. To enlarge the image just tap on the panel. If you have an apple system it is easy to enlarge the images even further:

Lot 47: McQuaid, Schildknecht(2), Schenkel, Wells, Hines, VAN DYKE, Rooks, Dunn, Powell, Hungler, O'CONNELL, Emmerke, Shaw, Werrick, Carroll, Cantz(2), Burks, Crooks, Vinton, West, Pickett, Minnehan, Duke, Dugdale, Knell, Hanrahan, Hart, Farmer, Herr, Mahoney, Patton, Smith, Brynan, Cline, Daly, Gunson, Hellman, Maskrey(error), Macullar (error)

Lot 49: Duryea, Carpenter, Collins, Duffe(2), Daley, Tebeau(2), Decker(2), Burns(2), Daley, Williamson,Whitney, Weyhing, Whitacre, Wood, Wise, Weidman,  Welch & Gleason, Tiernan, Sullivan (2), Sowders(2),  Devlin, Chamberlain, Tate, Brown, Deasley, Donahue, Esterday, Clarke, Sprague, Sterns, Stricker, Smith, Sowders, Stemmeyer, Sanders, Schriver, MASCOT, Porter(2), McTammany(2), Whitney, Staley(2), Hudson, Holbert, Lovett, Myers, Gilligan(2), Gastreich, Fulmer & Tucker, Griffin, Greenwood, Tucker, Pickett, Nichols, O'Neil, Mulvey, O'Brien, Murphy, Miller(2), Morris, McKinnon, Mattimore(2), Marr, Farmer, Boyle, Healey, Getzein, Burdick, Whitney, Myers, Seery, McKean, Clark, WARD, Gamble, Bierbauer & Gamble, Milligan, Twitchell(2), Titcomb(2), Robinson, Ferguson, Gardner, Geiss, Donnelly, Carroll, Faatz, Gleason, Gillespie, Shomberg, Long, DENNY(1890 card), Gunning, Gumbert, Hotaling, Hutchinson, George, Lauer.

Note: to prevent any misunderstandings, please note that until a potential buyer commits to a particular card, that card is still available for purchase by any other buyer. Once a card or cards is committed to, the card will be removed from the lists above.

Thanks--Jay
Crogan-Maroons gone
Dang :)
The Old Judge market seems to be pretty robust. Thank you to those who have ordered cards so far. There are still many great, scarce cards left, including two Maroons, Van Dyke, Mascot, etc.

If you don't see a card here please email and ask (oldjudge@gmail.com). Many more dups available. Also, will trade for other Old Judges and other 19th century photographic cards and cabinets. 

Thanks--Jay

In answer to questions posed, some of the extra better dups available are Behel, Brady (SGC84), Comiskey Browns Champ, Silver Flint portrait, Joe Miller, McLaughlin spotted tie, "Jim" Keefe error (trimmed), Barnes manager, plus many, many others.
